author: potuz
content: I'll try one last time here and will stop bugging, I've been trying to find out the rationale behind the choices for the inclusion distance in the accounting reform. We will require 5 slots to get a timely source and 32 for the target. Besides just making the source flag not automatic as it is now this choice seems arbitrary to me. Is there anotger reason for the shorter inclusion required on source rather than target?

author: jgm
content:
I ran some numbers to see what portion of votes would be considered timely.  It looks as though at least 1% of votes will not be considered timely, and for servers that take more time to generate attestations (poor network connectivity? lower CPU resources?) the drop can be significantly higher.

(Data was taken for a fixed set of epochs a week or two ago.)

This does seem somewhat of a retrograde move.  What would the impact be on the network if the source vote turns up after 6 slots, rather than 5?

author: potuz
content: More than being worried about getting less rewards I just don't see the point other than a desire to not award the `12/64` for simply getting the source correctly.
